column4: i like xubuntu over the remix.. on my eee 701 the remix ran slower then xubuntu
or go crunchbang for good speed
or if you have an eee 701 ... eeebuntu is still the best
thats pretty bloated, puppy is about 100Mb
ya i hear ya but I have never liked puppy's installer
doest matter, once its installed you never see the installer again
ya i dig puppy but i am an ubuntu fanboi these days don't really look at puppy much anymore. :)
check xpud if you are impress by boot times
boots in bout 5 seconds on my 1.6Ghz + 1Gb DDR2 + PATA HDD
not really, the functionality is quite limited, but hey..its boot time that matters right
theres even a boot image you can plonk in /boot and add a line to meu.lst
